sentence.Network_en: Talent, hard work and sheer tenacity are all crucial to career success.
sentence.Network_cn: 事业要成功，才能、勤奋和顽强的意志都至关重要。

sentence.Network_en: It is crucial that all documents presented are authentic and easily verifiable.
sentence.Network_cn: 所有提交的文件必须真实且易于查证，这一点很关键。

sentence.Network_en: The ability to separate out reusable elements from other waste is crucial.
sentence.Network_cn: 能从其他废料中分离出可重复利用成分是很关键的。

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 18th cent. (in the sense 'cross-shaped'): from French, from Latin crux, cruc- 'cross'. The sense 'decisive' is from Francis Bacon's Latin phrase instantia crucis 'crucial instance', which he explained as a metaphor from a crux or finger-post marking a fork at a crossroad; Newton and Boyle took up the metaphor in experimentum crucis 'crucial experiment'

entry.def: If you describe something as crucial, you mean it is extremely important.

example.ex: He had administrators under him but took the crucial decisions himself...
example.tran: 他手下有管理人员，但重要的决策仍由他自己来做。

example.ex: ...the most crucial election campaign for years...
example.tran: 几年来最重要的竞选活动

means.word_mean: 1. of extreme importance; vital to the resolution of a crisis;

sentences.sentence: "in chess cool nerves are of the essence"

means.word_mean: 4. having the power or quality of deciding;

stems_affixes.word_buile: cruc十字形,交叉+ial……的→十字路口→决定性的
cruc十字形,交叉+i+form形状→adj.十字形的
excruciate[v.施酷刑, 折磨, 使苦恼]+ion动作或状态→n.酷刑, 拷问

stems_affixes.value_cn: 施酷刑, 折磨, 使苦恼
stems_affixes.word_buile: ex出+cruc十字形,交叉+iate表动词→放在十字架上问出→拷打

Sentence.sentence: Democrats and Republicans can and will take sides on a number of issues, but a more crucial concern is that both are basing major policy decisions on guesstimates rather than looking at the vast wealth of raw data with a critical eye and an open mind.
Democrats and Republicans cooperate on crucial issues At some point in 2008, someone, probably in either Asia or Africa, made the decision to move from the countryside to the city
This is particularly crucial in the case of meat production, where beef uses about 50 times more water than vegetables.

means.word_mean: 决定性的, 紧要关头的, 至关重要的；关键性的

sentences.cn: 这是一个极其重要的决定。

sentences.en: The success of this experiment is crucial to the project as a whole.
sentences.cn: 这次试验的成功是整个工程的关键所在。

jushi.chinese: 这是一个极其重要的决定。

jushi.english: The success of this experiment is crucial to the project as a whole.
jushi.chinese: 这次试验的成功是整个工程的关键所在。

jushi.english: It was crucial for the future of our firm.
jushi.chinese: 这对我们公司的前途至关重要。
